item.title: Mexico 'not paying for that f***ing wall'
item.description: Former Mexican President Vicente Fox really doesn't like Donald Trump's proposed border wall.
item.ExtractedText: So much, in fact, that for the second time in two days, Fox used an expletive -- this time, on live TV -- to describe it. "I have to say that we are not, I am not going to pay for that f***ing wall," Fox said during a live interview with Maria Bartiromo on Fox Business Network on Friday morning, repeating the phrase that made waves when he used it a day earlier. This time however, the expletive went uncensored as a visibly stunned Bartiromo gasped. "I am not. And he should know that. And I am not going to apologize," Fox added. Read More Fox first made the inflammatory comments in an interview with Fusion's Jorge Ramos that was published Thursday, prompting Trump to demand an apology on Twitter and during a CNN debate Thursday night. "FMR PRES of Mexico, Vicente Fox horribly used the F word when discussing the wall. He must apologize! If I did that there would be a uproar!," Trump wrote on Twitter. FMR PRES of Mexico, Vicente Fox horribly used the F word when discussing the wall. He must apologize! If I did that there would be a uproar!
